Questions.text: Are found in the physical examination of patients with cardiac tamponade all, EXCEPT:

choices.text: Inspiratory fall in systolic blood pressure > 10 mmHg

Questions.text: Indicate the alternative that presents a lesser vascular phenotype-like criterion in the modified Duke criteria for infective endocarditis.
There are absolute contraindications to the use of thrombolytics in AMI with STEMI, except:

choices.text: Ischemic stroke in the last 3 months
Ischemic stroke in the last 6 months

Questions.text: In patients with pulmonary hypertension, pulmonary capillary pressure in right cardiac catheterization will be increased in the presence of:

Patient with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease becomes torporous after initiation of oxygen administration at 2 liters / minute. There are no further clinical changes. Oximetry shows 94% saturation. In this case,

choices.text: The most likely cause of numbness is hypercapnia
The oximeter measurement must be incorrect
The oxygen flow should be increased
The oxygen flow meter must be de-calibrated
